learning_objectives: Students will understand the concept of photosynthesis and its importance.
Students will identify the raw materials needed for photosynthesis.
Students will describe the process of photosynthesis in their own words.
Students will explain the role of chlorophyll in photosynthesis.

lesson_overview.title: Introduction to Photosynthesis
lesson_overview.description: Introduce the concept of photosynthesis, including its definition (from Greek roots meaning 'to put together with the help of light') and its significance in the ecosystem.

lesson_overview.title: Photosynthesis Process
lesson_overview.description: Explain the process of photosynthesis: the role of carbon dioxide, water, and sunlight in creating glucose and oxygen.

lesson_overview.title: Chlorophyll and Light Reactions
lesson_overview.description: Discuss the importance of chlorophyll in photosynthesis and the difference between light-dependent and light-independent reactions.

lesson_overview.title: Hands-on Experiment
lesson_overview.description: Conduct a simple experiment to demonstrate photosynthesis using plant samples to observe oxygen release.

exercises: Create a poster explaining the photosynthesis process using diagrams and bullet points.
Conduct an experiment to observe the release of oxygen in aquatic plants when exposed to light.
assessment: What are the main ingredients needed for photosynthesis?
Describe the role of chlorophyll in the photosynthesis process.
What are the products of photosynthesis?
